definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: thousands and thousands of people got infected with flu every year.
sentences.chinese: 每年不可胜数的人遭到风行性感冒感染。

sentences.english: Many people benefited from his countless generosities.
sentences.chinese: 很多人从他的不可胜数的慷慨大方里受益。

sentences.english: Today, the uses of aluminum are innumerable.
sentences.chinese: 今天铝的用途多得不可胜数。

sentences.english: Thousands of English words are derived from Latin. ;
sentences.chinese: 英语中有不可胜数的词源于拉丁文。

sentences.english: For many Chinese, there are big advantages to shopping online.
sentences.chinese: 对很多中国人来说，网上购物的好处不可胜数。

sentences.english: And the angel of the LORD said unto her, I will multiply thy seed exceedingly, that it shall not be numbered for multitude.
sentences.chinese: 又说，我必使你的后裔极其繁多，甚至不可胜数。

sentences.english: The military equipment captured was beyond counting.
sentences.chinese: 缴获的武器装备不可胜数。

sentences.english: Chinese gardens are well known in the world and beautiful Chinese landscapes are too numerous to count.
sentences.chinese: 中国园林世界闻名，山水风景更是不可胜数。

sentences.english: There was no counting the number of birds that had died before his barrel.
sentences.chinese: 去世在他枪筒里的鸟儿不可胜数。

sentences.english: Your servant is here among the people you have chosen, a great people, too numerous to count or number.
sentences.chinese: 仆人住在你所拣选的民中，这民多得不可胜数。

definition: one can't tell how many/numerous similar cases
lit. measured in cartloads and gallons/fig. by the barrowload (i.e. lots and lots)/innumerable
too numerous to mention individually or one by one
lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
countless as the grains of sand in the Ganges (idiom)
to be all the same way (literary)
none doesn't/there is none who isn't/everyone
by no means an isolated case/numerous
